page.title: 15FISHING IN BERKELEY PILL
page.content: The{Pill}is a popular place for {fishing}and as many as 20 people have been spotted there at once. The types of fish caught in the Pill include eels, rainbow trout, brown trout, grey ling, minnow, roach, dace, chub, gudgeon, stone loach and flounder. Every year{elvers}make their way up the River Severn to the Pill. They are about 3 years old when they arrive and stay several years until they become {eels,}they then return across the Atlantic to breed. When the elvers come, people arrive wearing waders, carrying large nets and catch the elvers as the tide comes in. They are considered a{delicacy}when fried in bacon fat or boiled. When the Pill was tidal boats used to carry cloth and wines upstream to {Berkeley Castle;}the{dam}has ended this, but it has improved the fishing.
